titleStmt.title: L. A. Wood to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1095

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville Ky
December 2d 1864
To His Excellency Gove Thos E. Bramltette

Dear Sir. Nellie Reeder was indicted by the Grand Jury at the present term of the Jefferson Circuit court upon a charge of Arson. She failed to appear to answer to her bond. I, and one Wm Evans are her bail. We believe she is in Jeffersonville Indianna. I Send you a copy of the Indictment; and we desire a requisition upon Gove Morton of Ind. for the accused Nellie Reeder. I believe a copy of the Indictment is all that is necessary to procure a requisition. She is a fugitive from Justice from this State. from Carter Tiller, a policeman of this city. desire to go after her and he is a Suitable person to go after her
Will you please enclose the necessary requisition for her.

Jefferson Cir Ct Indiana
Requisition for Nelly Reeder & appointment of Carter Tiller
5th Dec/64
